author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11208, 'playtime_forever': 46, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1706758191}
review:
This is a minimalist/asset flippy physics puzzle game where you need to shoot a ball at a bunch of objects to make them land in a landing zone, across a surreal landscape of floating platforms over some kind of body of water. 

I feel like the developer had some general intention of making a real game here, but it lacks polish, the gameplay is erratic and the controls far from precise, where precision and good handling are crucial for these kinds of games.   For some reason the game throws hundreds of achievements at you, which is the kind of thing I thought Valve was pulling games from the store for doing, but this one somehow lingers.  

Regardless there's better games than this on mobile app stores that you can get for free, so why would anyone pay $3 for this unpolished mess?

author: {'steamid': '76561198804992483', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1562263255}
review:
The idea behind Reach Me is pretty simplistic -- use balls to knock blocks onto a pad to unlock the gate and advance. While the premise of the game is not overly difficult nor complicated, I feel the programming could have been a bit better. The power of each shot each set by how far away from the launcher you move your mouse. Simple, though highly finicky. The angle and power don't seem to follow the mouse all that well at times. Aside from that, this is a fairly easy time-waster that doesn't require too much thought.

I picked this game up with a coupon for less than a dollar, so I won't complain about the price I paid.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057990658', 'num_games_owned': 6240, 'num_reviews': 1539, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1562036723}
review: I can't recommend you never touch this game more than any other game. The gameplay is absolutely atrocious and so finicky. The entire goal is to get these blocks onto a platform by either flinging balls at the or flinging the cubes themselves onto the platform. The way you fling the ball/cube is by holding right click and drawing back to increase or decrease it's speed. It's is so incredibly sensitive and I swear to god there's no inbetween speeds. You either launch at the equivalent of a gentle breeze or at mach 4. It was horrible. Don't play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117923961', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1684235421}

author: {'steamid': '76561198145510707', 'num_games_owned': 1155, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1527957190}
review:
I was really pleasently surprised by this game. The game mechanic is very easy to understand, but the puzzles are made in such a way that you are encouraged to think outside the box again and again. It took me around 3.5 hours to complete all 70 levels and unlock all the achievements simultaneously.

The soundtrack is very lovely and actually something I'd love to listen to again. The graphics are okay, nothing too pretty, but not at all ugly looking like some other games from this price category. The only problem I had was that some levels got really dark, which sometimes made it hard to see some objects for me. Definitely recommending this game to everyone who wants to try their hand at a casual physics puzzle.

I received this game for free from an acquaintance, not the developer/publisher.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024152277', 'num_games_owned': 5596, 'num_reviews': 146, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1520288529}
review:
"Reach Me" est un jeu facile √† comprendre et appr√©hender, fond√© sur le moteur physique d'Unity. Un peu dans l'esprit d'un Angry Birds, le joueur doit lancer des "projectiles" sur une structure √† droite de l'√©cran, afin de d√©truire/renverser les obstacles, profiter de tous les √©l√©ments permettant des rebonds et tremplins, le tout afin de permettre √† un certain nombre de cubes noirs d'√™tre en contact direct avec la plateforme d'arriv√©e.

Si au d√©part c'est assez rapide et simple, les niveaux se compliquent peu √† peu, comme tout jeu du genre. En misant sur la force d'envoi et l'angle, le joueur peut franchir les premiers niveaux sans probl√®me. Mais peu √† peu, d'autres √©l√©ments viennent compliquer la t√¢che, et il faudra s'y reprendre un bon nombre de fois pour r√©ussir un envoi sp√©cifique qui sera d'ailleurs parfois plus fond√© sur la chance qu'autre chose.

Malgr√© tout, ce jeu est plaisant et on se surprend √† d√©ployer de l'ing√©niosit√© pour s'en sortir, parfois assur√©ment autrement que ce qui a d√ª √™tre pr√©vu par les concepteurs. On reprochera en revanche √† ce jeu les tr√®s nombreux d√©fauts techniques et artistiques (touches WASD : merci pour les claviers "azerty" !, trop de troph√©es Steam pour rien : chaque niveau entra√Æne au moins 7 succ√®s identiques, une trop grande sobri√©t√© graphique : c'est ultra-minimaliste et intensifie trop l'impression de r√©p√©titivit√©), ...

"Reach Me" est donc un jeu de r√©flexion/action qui m√©riterait un polish √©norme pour devenir un jeu excellent. Les niveaux sont assez bien √©tudi√©s, plaisants, astucieux, ce qui fait que je le conseille, qui plus est vu le prix. Mais dans la mouture actuelle, "Reach Me" est divertissant quelques minutes (on bloque rapidement pour des raisons d'angle de vue et de gameplay/mouvement de souris perfectible). En esp√©rant donc que les concepteurs peaufineront le gameplay, la vue, la vari√©t√© des ambiances, et ce syst√®me de troph√©es qui frise le grotesque) : am√©lior√©, "Reach Me" a tout pour devenir un bon petit jeu physique classique auquel on aura plaisir de jouer et rejouer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110829497', 'num_games_owned': 6641, 'num_reviews': 368, 'playtime_forever': 1383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1383, 'last_played': 1518859926}
